programme.title: Roger Ep165/Ep166/Ep159/Ep160/Ep169/Ep162/Ep163/Ep164
programme.desc: Verrrrry Funny/Pilot's Licence/Fatou's Back/Lousy Lice/A Tall Order/A Whale Of Debt/Blind As A Pad/Roger's Gone Whacko - Roger tells Fatou a joke and it’s a really stupid joke because Roger can’t tell it right and it’s really embarrassing for Fatou because she really doesn’t dare tell her friend that he is a terrible joke teller. Still, Roger is aware of his shortcomings and is sorry, he knows he blew it. He would like so much to make Fatou laugh with a good joke, kind of like Igor does. So he decides to take joke-telling lessons with Igor, since Igor is apparently the king of jokes. But it backfires, Roger is still way too serious! But still determined to make Fatou laugh at one of his jokes, the alien decides that science is the solution. He invents a laughter ray which accompanies his jokes and it turns out to work pretty well. In fact so well that Irina, who is inadvertently struck by the ray, can’t stop laughing herself...to the point of endangering her life...!

programme.desc: CGTN's brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the world's most powerful laser and the world's smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. programme.title: Grand Designs Australia Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Peter Maddison meets Daniel Leipnik and Andrew Preston, who plan to build a slick, pavilion-style home, huddled around a pool and propped up by poles on a coastal hillside outside Cairns.

programme.title: ABC News Summer Ep6
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch throughout the day with ABC News. We've got more reporters in more places, to tell you what's happening and why it matters. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: ABC News Hour Ep6
programme.desc: There's never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the latest news and the day's top stories, with reporters on the ground to tell you what's happening and why it matters.

programme.title: ABC Evening News Ep6
programme.desc: When you need to know what's happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you the day's events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Lara Hyams.

programme.title: ABC National News Ep6
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and the day's top stories. Plus reporters investigating the issues that matter. Presented by Lara Hyams.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep1
programme.desc: Australia's premier daily current affairs show is back in 2023, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Presented by David Speers. (Return)

programme.title: ABC News Tonight Ep6
programme.desc: More news, more often - the home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the issues that matter. With a network of reporters we uncover important stories and bring you news and information you need. Presented by Lara Hyams.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep21
programme.desc: One man's decade-long mission to expose the extent of an alarming chemical contamination scandal. Then, with no medical training, firefighter Mick Tisbury found an ingenious solution to help those who'd been exposed.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News Ep6
programme.desc: Stay in touch with the latest news and the best coverage of the day's top stories. With reporters in more places, ABC News connects communities and tells the stories that matter to you. Plus breaking news and live reports.

programme.title: Rosie Batty's One Plus One Ep6
programme.desc: Comedian Hannah Gadsby was already a success in the stand-up world when her special Nanette catapulted her to global stardom. She talks to Rosie Batty about fame, growing up in Tasmania, and finding her place in the world.

programme.title: The World Ep6
programme.desc: Know what's going on in our world. Beverley O'Connor presents the latest international news and a complete look at today's events with reports from ABC News correspondents and interviews with experts, commentators and guests.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent Ep17
programme.desc: Across Thailand a quiet revolution is underway. Hundreds of women are defying generations of Thai tradition and ordaining as Theravada Buddhist monks. Mazoe Ford follows two Thai women on a deeply spiritual quest.

programme.desc: There's never been a more important time for transparency and trust. Turn to ABC News for comprehensive coverage of the day's news from reporters on the ground to tell you what's happening and why it matters.

programme.title: ABC Late News Ep6
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest coverage of the day's events, explaining what's happening and why it matters. ABC News reporters across Australia and around the globe so we're on the scene to cover the news as it unfolds.

programme.title: Next Gen Agriculture Ep3
programme.desc: Only seven students from kindergarten to year six attend the remote Hermidale Public School, more than 600 kilometres west of Sydney. Plus they've planted and cared for their own 85-hectare wheat crop.

programme.desc: How deep will the housing downturn go? We speak to property analysts, economists and real estate agents about whether prices will rebound in 2023 plus top tips on buying or selling in this market. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia Ep10
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Michael Parkinson interviews guests Barry Humphries, Little River Band with Glenn Shorrock and Carol Raye.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 30 - Sophie Thomson gets a visit from a butterfly expert, Costa Georgiadis and Millie Ross travels to west Arnhem land, Josh Byrne dives into a seagrass revegetation project and Jerry Coleby-Williams talks Cat's claw creepers.

programme.title: News Breakfast: Early Ep7
programme.desc: There's always something new to talk about over breakfast. Michael Rowland and Nour Haydar bring you the latest news and interviews, Madeleine Morris with finance, Michael Rennie with sport and Stephanie Ferrier with weather.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep7
programme.desc: When big stories break, turn to Joe O'Brien in the mornings to bring you what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has more reporters in more places, serving and connecting communities and telling your stories.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep7
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Karina Carvalho brings you the day's top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep7
programme.desc: Sr. 30 - Jerry Coleby-Williams visits a bushland botanic gardens, Millie Ross looks at climbing plants, Tino Carnevale shares tool tips, Josh Byrne explores an inspiring revegetation project and we meet a passionate frog expert.

programme.title: Dream Gardens Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 3 - A young family turns their back on city life for a home with a garden spacious enough to accommodate all their needs. But can they balance a myriad of ideas to delight both parents and children?

programme.desc: Sr. 3 - Ernie explores Melville Island and meets an expert carver, an Aussie with a passion for fishing and a young man who's reached the pinnacle of AFL and has returned to work for his people.

programme.title: DocFilm
programme.desc: The Great Toilet Battle - A toilet revolution is set to bring much-needed change when it comes to human waste. Each day, a single person produces one liter of urine and 200 grams of feces. In many places, feces is flushed down the toilet using around six liters of water, generating millions of tons of waste.

programme.desc: In this episode, we learn about the fall chrysanthemum festival and the autumnal equinox, or shubun. The nuns enjoy sushi, salad, and dumplings made specially for the occasion.

programme.title: Trails To Oishii Tokyo Mini
programme.desc: Shirasu are baby Japanese anchovies. Known for their clear, silvery-white appearance, these tiny things are packed with umami and nutrients.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: This time, we follow Canadian Josh Grisdale in his work to promote a better understanding of people with disabilities in Tokyo, and meet Vietnamese Hoang Quoc Viet, a wallpaper installer in Saitama.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: "Homework Challenges." Elsa is from the Faroe Islands. Her two children attend a Japanese public school. She feels sad that she cannot always help them because of language issues.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Core Kyoto Mini
programme.desc: The head Inari shrine has 30,000 subordinate shrines throughout Japan. Since its foundation in 711, the Inari deities attract worshippers with varying needs.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Robin Takashi Lewis developed an app to reduce consumption of single-use plastic bottles. He shares how he's creatively working on changing mindsets, one bottle at a time.

programme.title: Grand Sumo Highlights
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from January 9, Day 2 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Tokyo.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Time-Lapse Journey
programme.desc: Experience the fascinating sights of the airports and transport hubs which connect Japan with the world. Time-lapse photography will show you how these places bustle with activity around the clock.

programme.title: Learn Japanese From The News
programme.desc: We listen to a story about measures the health ministry has compiled to prevent fever clinics from being overwhelmed this winter amid growing concerns of a dual outbreak of COVID-19 and the flu.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #25 My throat hurts. / To explain a part of your body that ails you, say the part, then the particle "ga," followed by adjectives like "itai," meaning painful, and finally "n desu."

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: After the Great East Japan Earthquake on 2011, the song "Flowers Will Bloom" was created in support of those affected by the disaster. Now the song is about to be reborn in 11 languages!

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Shibuya Zarny provides relief supplies and offers language and sewing classes in his native Myanmar, which is in a state of civil war following a coup. He shares his perspective as a former refugee.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life:Enoshima Crossing
programme.desc: Pilgrims have gathered on a beach along the Kanagawa coast, near Kamakura. Their destination is Enoshima, an island offering leisure, adventure, and spirituality. But first, they had to get across...

programme.title: NHK Documentary
programme.desc: A Buddhist nun lives in a mountain temple, in tune with the changing seasons and preparing vegetarian dishes for visitors from near and far. Together, they celebrate the simple things in life.

programme.title: Time-Lapse Japan Tohoku
programme.desc: Stunning time-lapse images offer a new angle on Tohoku, northeast Japan. Daisuke Shimizu, time-lapse creator's camera conveys features of the region's relationship with the deceased.

programme.title: The Sea Of Japan
programme.desc: Frigid winter winds bring stormy weather to the Sea of Japan, but undersea, life flourishes. Shoals of Japanese amberjack migrate to the area, and deep-sea fishes come into the shallows to spawn.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: An innovative surgical model called the bionic humanoid is expected to greatly increase the quality of training and improve the skills of novice doctors.

programme.title: Jom Masak Musim Pertama Ep1
programme.desc: Pemain-pemain bola sepak tempatan menunjukkan kemahiran memasak mereka dan berkongsi pengalaman serta aksi memasak yang pasti mencuit hati. Rancangan ini dapat memberi Inspirasi kepada peminat yang menonton

programme.title: Sensasi Bola Ep11
programme.desc: Sensasi Bola merupakan satu program bual bicara berdurasi setengah jam bersama pemain bola sepak, selebriti, jurulatih dan peminat sebagai tetamu undangan setiap minggu. Antara topik menarik yang akan dikupas adalah isu mengenai bola sepak tempatan dan antarabangsa, temubual ekslusif bersama lagenda bola sepak, tips kesihatan serta isu semasa yang menjadi perbualan masa kini.

programme.title: Road To UFC Ep5
programme.desc: ROAD TO UFC is a ground-breaking “win and advance” tournament that gives top MMA prospects from Asia a pathway to a UFC contract. Eight mixed martial arts athletes will compete in each of four men’s weight classes: flyweight, bantamweight, featherweight and lightweight. The opening round is divided into four episodes, each of which includes four tournament bouts and one additional non-tournament bout. These non-tournament bouts are included for promising prospects whose divisions might not have been included in ROAD TO UFC.
